intro: Lappa bardana subsp. minor, commonly known as lesser lappa, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
